content:
• Thursday, March 29, 2012
  • ARCT-OLD

    American Realty Capital Trust (NASDAQ:ARCT-OLD) dips in after hours trading after announcing the...

    American Realty Capital Trust (NASDAQ:ARCT-OLD) dips in after hours trading after announcing the withdrawal of its secondary offering. The company says it withdrew the registration statement because it was pleased with the results of its recent tender offer. Shares -3.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (NASDAQ:DRIV-OLD) +4.3% AH after George Soros discloses he has taken a 7.98% stake...

    Digital River (NASDAQ:DRIV-OLD) +4.3% AH after George Soros discloses he has taken a 7.98% stake in the e-commerce services provider, via the purchase of 2% convertible debt due 2030.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM
  • SNSS

    Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SNSS) reaches a deal with Royalty Pharma offering $25M for the...

    Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SNSS) reaches a deal with Royalty Pharma offering $25M for the development of its experimental anti-cancer drug Vosaroxin. The drug uses a class of compounds not previously included in cancer treatments that aims to inhibit certain cell functions that help spread cancer. Shares +12.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion says on its earnings call (webcast) it expects FQ1 revenue to decline from...

    Research In Motion says on its earnings call (webcast) it expects FQ1 revenue to decline from FQ4's $4.19B; the consensus is for $4.26B. RIM also expects its gross margin to face ongoing pressure, and FY13 subscriber growth to fall from FY12's level. It also wants to achieve over $1B in annual cost savings through a restructuring program, and plans to abandon most consumer markets. RIMM now down 2.3% AH. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 4 Comments
  • XRTX

    More on Xyratex's (NASDAQ:XRTX) FQ1: Revenue was impacted by an inability of the company's...

    More on Xyratex's (NASDAQ:XRTX) FQ1: Revenue was impacted by an inability of the company's storage subsystem business to secure adequate hard drive supplies in the face of industry shortages. The company sets broad guidance ranges, forecasting FQ2 revenue of $297M-$357M and EPS of $0.16-$0.43 (consensus is for $341.7M and $0.35). XRTX -13% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading, and is currently down 6.8% AH after missing FQ4...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading, and is currently down 6.8% AH after missing FQ4 estimates, discontinuing guidance, and announcing major executive departures (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • BB

    More on Research In Motion's FQ4: 500K PlayBook tablets shipped - improvement from FQ3's 150K,...

    More on Research In Motion's FQ4: 500K PlayBook tablets shipped - improvement from FQ3's 150K, but still a small figure. Total BlackBerry subs rose over 2M Q/Q to 77M+, below expectations for a 4M gain. In spite of 25% revenue drop, R&D/SG&A expenses only fell 5% Y/Y, adding to margin pressure. RIM is reviewing "strategic opportunities" such as partnerships and licensing deals. RIMM to resume trading at 5:10 ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $295.7M (-18% Y/Y) misses by...

    Xyratex (NASDAQ:XRTX): FQ1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $295.7M (-18% Y/Y) misses by $21M. Shares -12.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ4 EPS of $0.80 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $4.19B (-25% Y/Y) misses...

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ4 EPS of $0.80 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $4.19B (-25% Y/Y) misses by $350M. 11.1M BlackBerry shipments, below expectations of 11.8M. Company is discontinuing "providing specific quantitative guidance." Former chairman/co-CEO Jim Balsillie has resigned from the company's board, CTO David Yach and COO Jim Rowan also leaving. Shares halted. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 22 Comments
  • TIBX

    Tibco Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $225.7M (+21.8% Y/Y)...

    Tibco Software (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $225.7M (+21.8% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • RENN

    Renren's (RENN +3.2%) spike near the close may be attributable to a Washington Post article...

    Renren's (RENN +3.2%) spike near the close may be attributable to a Washington Post article speculating that Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) is seeking a partner in China. FB has held a range of investment and partnership talks with the country's top internet players, the story says, which could bring the Chinese government on board. But BIDU -1.1% and SINA -1.4% both finished lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • ONE

    Higher One (ONE -4%) finished the day lower after Goldman downgraded the shares to Neutral,...

    Higher One (ONE -4%) finished the day lower after Goldman downgraded the shares to Neutral, citing reduced near-term visibility and risk to management's 2012 outlook. The firm also cut its price target to $15 from $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • WMB

    Williams (NYSE:WMB) -3.1% AH after announcing a 26M share stock offering, good for proceeds of...

    Williams (NYSE:WMB) -3.1% AH after announcing a 26M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $795M based on today's close. Williams says it will use the proceeds to buy additional common units of subsidiary Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ), in order to finance the latter's acquisition of Caiman Midstream. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +2.1%) shares gyrate wildly after an FDA advisory panel votes to require...

    Vivus (VVUS +2.1%) shares gyrate wildly after an FDA advisory panel votes to require cardiovascular outcomes trials for drugs without a theoretical risk or signal for cardiovascular harm. The vote could be seen as a negative for weight-loss drug companies such as VVUS, OREX -2% and ARNA +5.3%, who now may have to run additional tests to convince the FDA of a drug's safety.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 5 Comments
  • BKI-OLD

    Buckeye Tech (BKI-OLD -3.5%) drops after being downgraded to Sector Perform at RBC Capital,...

    Buckeye Tech (BKI-OLD -3.5%) drops after being downgraded to Sector Perform at RBC Capital, citing a lack of catalysts and increased competition. The firm also lowers its price target to $37 from $44.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • UNH

    The DJIA pokes its head into the green after being down nearly 100 points earlier. The S&P...

    The DJIA pokes its head into the green after being down nearly 100 points earlier. The S&P 500 (-0.3%) and Nasdaq (-0.3%) remain slightly negative. Leading on the upside are the health insurers as analysts conclude it's bullish if the Obamacare mandate is struck down and bullish if it's upheld. Sweet!

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • GBDC

    Golub Capital (GBDC +2.3%) gains after Wells Fargo upgraded the shares to Outperform on...

    Golub Capital (GBDC +2.3%) gains after Wells Fargo upgraded the shares to Outperform on valuation earlier today, and raised its price target range to $14.50 - $15.25 from $14.00 - $14.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • VVUS

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +8.1%) skyrocket after sitting in negative territory for most of the day....

    Shares of Vivus (VVUS +8.1%) skyrocket after sitting in negative territory for most of the day. Traders are locked in on the tone from an ongoing FDA panel that covers the firm's Qnexa weight-loss drug.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 13 Comments
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA -18%) shares are crushed on the delay of its FQ3 results, but B. Riley...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA -18%) shares are crushed on the delay of its FQ3 results, but B. Riley is not overly concerned, doubting the delay is anything more than determining when acountants recognize some transactions. "What matters most is that these deals appear to have closed," not when they will be reported, the firm argues, while still cutting shares to Neutral after a 29% gain YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • RVLT

    Nexxus Lighting (NEXS -2.5%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral at Wedbush earlier today....

    Nexxus Lighting (NEXS -2.5%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral at Wedbush earlier today. The firm cites slower Array LED sales growth and increasing cash burn following the company's Q4 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH -17.3%) shares slide after the health revenue manager agrees to no longer...

    Accretive Health (AH -17.3%) shares slide after the health revenue manager agrees to no longer collect debts on behalf of Minnesota hospital operator Fairview Health Services, in an attempt to resolve a legal dispute with the state's attorney general. AH estimates the change will lower its FY12 revenue by $62M-$64M, or ~6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM

  • Russia makes its first gold sale in 5 years, according to IMF data showing the country unloaded...

    Russia makes its first gold sale in 5 years, according to IMF data showing the country unloaded 3.8 tons in February. It's a big shift for the central bank which had been one of the more aggressive official buyers of the metal, more than doubling reserves since 2006.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 22 Comments
  • PNR

    William Blair adds to Pentair's (PNR +1.4%) gains after upping the shares to Outperform earlier,...

    William Blair adds to Pentair's (PNR +1.4%) gains after upping the shares to Outperform earlier, citing potential acceleration in earnings growth following the merger with Tyco’s (TYC +0.5%) flow control unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • MTL

    Shares of Russian-based steel and coking coal producer Mechel (MTL -5.5%) swoon after the...

    Shares of Russian-based steel and coking coal producer Mechel (MTL -5.5%) swoon after the company says it expects to breach certain lending deals and is in talks with banks to waive debt covenants after prices for its products declined last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • AOBC

    KeyBank reiterates a Buy rating on Smith & Wesson (SWHC +0.7%) on the strength of its...

    KeyBank reiterates a Buy rating on Smith & Wesson (SWHC +0.7%) on the strength of its potential to grab market share after rival Sturm Ruger says that it's maxed out the ability to fill new orders in Q1. Gun demand is smoking hot this year, helping shares of SWHC power to a 77.5% YTD return.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • KITD

    More on KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +12.6%) (previous): Roth Capital analyst Richard Ingrassia feels a...

    More on KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +12.6%) (previous): Roth Capital analyst Richard Ingrassia feels a sale might be "underway" after conducting independent checks and talking to execs. Potential acquirers run the gambit from IBM, Cisco, Accenture, and Alcatel-Lucent - as well as a number of private equity firms.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +4.7%) adds to Tuesday's big gains after Morgan Stanley reports Chinese rare earth...

    Molycorp (MCP +4.7%) adds to Tuesday's big gains after Morgan Stanley reports Chinese rare earth prices jumped 10% on average yesterday, per industry site Metal Pages. The firm adds it continues to believe rare earth prices have fallen to a level that will stoke demand, and predicts a seasonal pickup will will help stabilize prices. REE +2.3%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS -5.7%) is off sharply falling its FQ3 miss, which was marked by slumping margins....

    Mosaic (MOS -5.7%) is off sharply falling its FQ3 miss, which was marked by slumping margins. The timing of the miss is unfortunate for Stifel, which is starting coverage on rival Potash (POT -1.8%) with a Buy, arguing continued crop pricing strength and Chinese demand will give shares a lift. Also trading lower: CF -3.5%. TNH -2.5%. AGU -1.3%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • DK

    Credit Suisse upgrades refiner Delek (DK +1%) to Outperform and raises its price target to...

    Credit Suisse upgrades refiner Delek (DK +1%) to Outperform and raises its price target to $20.50 from $18.50, and lowers its rating on HollyFrontier (HFC -2.9%) to Neutral. The firm cites favorable crude oil pricing for DK, projects that could add to earnings and its declaration of a special dividend; HFC draws a downgrade partly because of its YTD outperformance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (RHT +16.1%) is now at multi-year highs following its FQ4 beat (I, II) strong FY13...

    Red Hat (RHT +16.1%) is now at multi-year highs following its FQ4 beat (I, II) strong FY13 guidance, and new stock buyback plan. Helping is an upgrade to Buy from BofA, which sees Red Hat benefiting from the conversion of free Linux users to paid subscribers, rising selling prices, the cross-selling of its JBoss middleware,growing virtualization software sales, and expansion into new verticals. (Goldman) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +8.4%) shoots higher after Roth Capital discusses a potential sale of the...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD +8.4%) shoots higher after Roth Capital discusses a potential sale of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • AET

    The market's interpreting the Supreme Court hearings over Obamacare as positive for insurers,...

    The market's interpreting the Supreme Court hearings over Obamacare as positive for insurers, which are getting a lift. Comments from Justices indicate they believe that if mandatory insurance is struck down, they may have to also void the rule requiring carriers to provide coverage to all. AET +5.3%, CVH +4.6%, CI +3.9%, UNH +3.4%, HUM +1.9%, WLP +2.1%, HNT +3.1%. (previously I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -5.5%) dips after saying it received a notice from Nasdaq...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -5.5%) dips after saying it received a notice from Nasdaq warning that the drug maker's stock price is too low, putting the company in danger of being de-listed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -3.8%) and Starbucks (SBUX -1.9%) head lower after Nielsen estimates...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -3.8%) and Starbucks (SBUX -1.9%) head lower after Nielsen estimates Starbucks' K-Cups only claimed 12%-14% market share in the 4 weeks ending March 17. However, Goldman isn't too worried, predicting Starbucks K-Cup sales will rise after the products begin to be offered in company stores this fall. International expansion is expected to drive growth in later years.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIG

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG -7%) sink as Deutsche Bank expresses concern about near-term sales...

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG -7%) sink as Deutsche Bank expresses concern about near-term sales trends. Consumables, which make up ~30% of BIG's product mix, "appear to be under duress" due to less closeout availability and the departure of several product buyers, the firm says. Also, BIG had a series of insider trades in March, including a 227K-share sale by CEO Steve Fishman.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • DLPH

    Delphi Automotive (DLPH +1%) moves higher on a Citigroup upgrade to Buy on valuation. The firm...

    Delphi Automotive (DLPH +1%) moves higher on a Citigroup upgrade to Buy on valuation. The firm cites higher North American production expectations and easing Europe concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • S

    Deutsche Bank makes a bullish call on Sprint (S +0.9%), adding the company to its Short-Term Buy...

    Deutsche Bank makes a bullish call on Sprint (S +0.9%), adding the company to its Short-Term Buy List with a price target of $3. Analysts came back from a meeting with Sprint management with a clear vision of the company's priorities and growth targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • JBLU

    While some analysts pin JetBlue's (NASDAQ:JBLU) 7.3% drop to a rogue pilot tarnishing its brand,...

    While some analysts pin JetBlue's (NASDAQ:JBLU) 7.3% drop to a rogue pilot tarnishing its brand, a big part of the move likely stems from Lufthansa's (OTCQX:DLAKY) decision to reduce its stake in the carrier with a corporate bond exchange.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • PRSS

    Shares of CafePress (NASDAQ:PRSS) open trading at $21.50 after the company already priced its...

    Shares of CafePress (NASDAQ:PRSS) open trading at $21.50 after the company already priced its offering above expectations at $19 a pop. Fellow debutantes from this week - Annie's and Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) - are still rocking gains of over 80% from their initial pricing as a sudden dose of IPO fever on the Street could be lining up just right for Facebook's (NASDAQ:FB) May launch.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • JBLU

    JetBlue (JBLU -8.1%) falls off sharply in a move that is attributed in part to a tarnishing of...

    JetBlue (JBLU -8.1%) falls off sharply in a move that is attributed in part to a tarnishing of its brand name by a pilot who grabbed headlines this week by having an in-flight meltdown.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 3 Comments
  • PHM

    Pulte Group (PHM -5%) leads a decline in homebuilders (XHB -2%) after S&P Capital IQ cuts...

    Pulte Group (PHM -5%) leads a decline in homebuilders (XHB -2%) after S&P Capital IQ cuts PHM to Strong Sell from Hold. The firm expects foreclosure activity to pick up as the year progresses, adding additional pressure to prices and new home sales, and sees housing growth below consensus. Hovnanian (HOV -3.5%) also is cut to Sell.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • VELTF

    Mobile marketing agency Velti (VELT +3.4%), discussed today by SA's Ted Stamas, appears to be...

    Mobile marketing agency Velti (VELT +3.4%), discussed today by SA's Ted Stamas, appears to be getting a lift from Millennial Media's (MM +98%) stellar IPO. Though the companies aren't direct competitors, it's worth noting Velti has a market cap of $892M on 2011 revenue of $189.2M, while Millennial has a market cap of $1.93B on 2011 gross revenue of $103.7M (and lower net revenue).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • AINV

    Apollo Investment (AINV +1.9%) gains this morning after Wells Fargo ups the shares to Outperform...

    Apollo Investment (AINV +1.9%) gains this morning after Wells Fargo ups the shares to Outperform on valuation and expectations for a turnaround. The firm also raises its price target range to $9.00 - $9.50 from $7.50 - $8.00.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • ILMN

    Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -0.9%) could up its bid even further if Illumina (ILMN +2%) were to hold...

    Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -0.9%) could up its bid even further if Illumina (ILMN +2%) were to hold talks, according to sources familiar with the situation. The drug giant just raised its bid to $51 a share, but could go higher still if talks were agreed to and Roche saw more value in its business. Roche is facing opposition from Baillie Gifford, Illumina's second-largest shareholder with an 11% stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • APOL

    Argus reduces its rating on Apollo Group (APOL -0.4%) to Hold from Buy. The action comes on...

    Argus reduces its rating on Apollo Group (APOL -0.4%) to Hold from Buy. The action comes on concerns about future enrollment and as shares close in on their 52-week lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • MM

    Mobile advertising firm Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) more than doubles its price as it debuts on...

    Mobile advertising firm Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) more than doubles its price as it debuts on the NYSE, opening at $25 after pricing at $13, the high end of its expected IPO range. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • RXN

    After pricing its IPO at $18, Rexnord (NYSE:RXN) opened at $19.05 and is currently trading at...

    After pricing its IPO at $18, Rexnord (NYSE:RXN) opened at $19.05 and is currently trading at $19.36, up 7.6%. Apollo Global (NYSE:APO), which now holds a 69.1% stake in the industrial parts maker, must be pleased. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • BBY

    Positive early reaction to Best Buy's (BBY -6.2%) Q4 report gives way to negative sentiment, as...

    Positive early reaction to Best Buy's (BBY -6.2%) Q4 report gives way to negative sentiment, as the stock is now the S&P's biggest loser. Focus apparently shifted away from the introduction of cost-cutting steps to same-store sales, which fell 2.4%, and flat gross margin. FY 2013 guidance has EPS $3.50-$3.80 vs. $3.70 consensus, revenues $50B-$51B vs. $51.84B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods Market (WFM) -2.1% premarket after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Neutral from...

    Whole Foods Market (WFM) -2.1% premarket after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy while raising its price target to $88 from $85. The firm says the strong fundamental story is unchanged, but it sees only 2.8% upside to its upwardly revised price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTEM

    Shares of Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) gain 5.5% in premarket trading after Lazard Capital...

    Shares of Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) gain 5.5% in premarket trading after Lazard Capital lifts its price target to a high-flying $15 after digesting the firm's good results from a trial of its pancreatic cancer drug candidate.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • Market preview: It's red all over the globe today, with U.S. futures maintaining losses after...

    Market preview: It's red all over the globe today, with U.S. futures maintaining losses after disappointing jobless claims. S&P Benchmark -0.3% as investors prepare for more consolidation following the market’s recent strong run. Illumina +4.45% after Roche ups its bid. Later: None-stop Fed speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • PSS

    Premarket gainers: PSS +11%. RHT +7%. THLS +6%. ILMN +4%. ZLCS +3%. HERO +3%. BNNY +3%.Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: PSS +11%. RHT +7%. THLS +6%. ILMN +4%. ZLCS +3%. HERO +3%. BNNY +3%.
    Losers: CHTP -29%. NBG -6%. NCT -5%. JBLU -4%. BBY -4%. ATPG -3%. ONTY -3%. MTL -3%. ING -3%. BCS -3%. VVUS -3%. ARNA -3%. TOT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • LORL

    Loral Space & Communications (NASDAQ:LORL) +4.1% premarket after its board declares a...

    Loral Space & Communications (NASDAQ:LORL) +4.1% premarket after its board declares a special dividend of $13.60/share for an aggregate dividend of up to $421M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • PSS

    Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS) +10.1% premarket following a Korean business newspaper report that...

    Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS) +10.1% premarket following a Korean business newspaper report that South Korean retailer E-land is planning a $1.8B bid for the owner of Payless and Stride Rite shoe stores. PSS had announced last August plans to shutter underperforming stores and conduct a strategic review.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • RHT

    Goldman Sachs weighs in on Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) after its earnings report score, calling the...

    Goldman Sachs weighs in on Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) after its earnings report score, calling the quarter a "good comeback" for the company after it missed by a whisker in FQ1. Analysts with Goldman takes their price target on RHT up to $50, as they see Red Hat's theme of replacing expensive proprietary UNIX servers with commodity platforms firing on all cylinders. Shares +8.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) tumbles 23% after the FDA asks for an additional study to...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) tumbles 23% after the FDA asks for an additional study to show the durability of the company's Northera drug over a 2-3 month period. The request comes despite an agency panel recommending approval of Northera, which is designed to help stop patients with conditions like Parkinson's disease from tumbling.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • BBY

    More on Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) Q4: Domestic segment online revenue grew 21% Y/Y. Tablets and...

    More on Best Buy's (NYSE:BBY) Q4: Domestic segment online revenue grew 21% Y/Y. Tablets and eReaders comparable store sales each increased low triple-digits in U.S. Plans to make $850M in cost reductions by FY15, including closing 50 big box stores in FY13. Will open 100 small format stand-alone mobile stores. Sees FY13 sales of $50B-$51B and EPS of $3.50-$3.80. Shares +4.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Q4 EPS of $2.47 beats by $0.31. Revenue of $16.6B (+3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY): Q4 EPS of $2.47 beats by $0.31. Revenue of $16.6B (+3% Y/Y) misses by $620M. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • AXP

    American Express (NYSE:AXP) is downgraded to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, with the price...

    American Express (NYSE:AXP) is downgraded to Market Perform at Wells Fargo, with the price target raised from $52-57 to $60-64. It's a strict valuation call, with Wells saying the current price of $59 and a price target of $60-64 doesn't warrant an Outperform. Shares -1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) looks to raise as much as $2B with a sale of its Lands' End business,...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) looks to raise as much as $2B with a sale of its Lands' End business, according to a report. The company seeks a buyer willing to license Lands End to Sears, while it invests in global growth. Shares of SHLD +6.6% premarket to $73.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 AM | 7 Comments
  • ILMN

    Shares of Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) tack on a 2.6% gain premarket to $51.16 after Roche raises its...

    Shares of Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) tack on a 2.6% gain premarket to $51.16 after Roche raises its offer to buy the company to $51. JPMorgan doesn't think the action is over and is out with an early morning call for shares to run up to $55.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 AM

    Jefferies downgrades Janus Capital (NYSE:JNS) to Hold from Buy on its view that the firm is...
